subject: Re: JUnit 3 - compatibility - getName() method
msgSnippet: Your problem looks like mine! Anthony ... convenient ... the test to ... problem you
messageBody:
Your problem looks like mine!

Anthony

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Nat Pryce" <nat.pryce@...> wrote:
>
> On 26/03/2008, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
> > There is no easy replacement for getName(). I too often miss that
convenient
> > object encapsulating the test fixture and the specification of
the test to
> > be run. What would constitute a good solution depends on what
problem you
> > are solving with the name. Can you say a little more about this?
>
> I also miss getName() and an object model representing tests. I've
> found the disappearance of JUnit's domain model in version 4
> problematic a few times.
>
> Most recently, I wanted to record and save desktop videos of failing
> tests that exercised the GUI. I did this by attaching a test listener
> using the Ant JUnit runner (actually an output formatter in Ant-lingo,
> but it inherits from test listener) which started recording a video
> file when the test started and stopped recording when the test
> finished. The video file was named after the test. It worked fine in
> JUnit 3. However, the JUnit4 adapter did not expose methods to let me
> calculate the name of the file from the test class and method names.
>
> --Nat
>
